param

Class Lumper

  • java.lang.Object
    • param.Lumper
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NullLumper, StrongLumper, WeakLumper

    abstract class Lumper
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for signature-based bisimulation lumping. Derived classes could implement specific types of bisimulation, e.g. weak, strong, etc.
    Author:
    Ernst Moritz Hahn (University of Oxford)
    See Also:
    NullLumper, StrongLumper, WeakLumper

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  Lumper.BisimType
      Kind of lumping to be used.
      (package private) class  Lumper.RewardEntry
      Stores combination of state reward and state time.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lumper

        Lumper(MutablePMC origPmc)
        Creates new lumper for given parametric Markov chain.
        Parameters:
        origPmc - Markov chain to build lumper for

      • Lumper

        protected Lumper()
        Creates a new lumper. This constructor needs to be present for technical reasons.

    • Method Detail

      • createInitialPartition

        protected void createInitialPartition()
        Creates an initial partitioning appropriate for analysis to perform. For reachability, takes care that only target-states / non-target are stored in one initial block, for reward analyses takes care that only states with same reward are subsumed, etc. For certain types of bisimulations, this is not enough, and the initial partition must be refined further before starting the main refinement process. This is the case for instance for weak bisimulation.

      • getQuotient

        MutablePMC getQuotient()
        Return the quotient of the original model. Before calling this method, lump() must have been called.
        Returns:
        quotient of original model

      • mapBlocksToNumber

        protected void mapBlocksToNumber()
        Enumerates the blocks after refinement is finished. This is done as a preparation to create the quotient and the mapping from original to quotient states.

      • getOriginalToOptimised

        int[] getOriginalToOptimised()
        Returns a mapping from original model states to quotient states. Thus, is the state of the quotient to which state belongs.
        Returns:
        mapping from original model states to quotient states

      • lump

        protected void lump()
        Perform the lumping process. Refines blocks from the list of blocks to refine, it is clear that further tries to refine blocks will not lead to the creation of any new blocks.

      • refineBlock

        protected abstract void refineBlock(java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> oldBlock,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer>> newBlocks)
        Refine a given block. The exact way of how this is done depends on the type of bisimulation used.
        Parameters:
        oldBlock - block to refine
        newBlocks - list of new blocks generated

      • buildQuotient

        protected abstract void buildQuotient()
        Build the quotients after refinement has finished. Each state of the quotient will be a block of states from the original model. The exact way of how transitions between states are computed depends on the type of bisimulation used.
